article.headline: Creighton 67, Indiana State 62
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- No deficit seems insurmountable at home for Creighton. Johnny Mathies scored 18 points, Anthony Tolliver 15 and Nick Porter 14 as Creighton rallied from 14 down in the second half to defeat Indiana State 67-62 on Wednesday night. The victory kept Creighton (19-7, 12-5 Missouri Valley Conference) in the MVC title picture and left them one away from their eighth straight 20-win season. For the Sycamores (12-14, 4-13), Gabriel Moore scored 17 points, Tyson Schnitker 16 and David Moss 14. All of Moss' points came in the first half. The Bluejays improved to 14-1 at home with another remarkable comeback on Senior Night as Mathies, who had a career-high seven steals, Jeffrey Day and Jimmy Motz played their last home games. "I thought we showed a lot of resiliency and toughness in fighting back," Creighton coach Dana Altman said. "We were in trouble, obviously." Trailing 45-31 four minutes into the second half, the Bluejays scored 16 straight points against the foul-plagued Sycamores. Mathies had eight in a row, sandwiching two 3-pointers around a pair of free throws to help put Creighton ahead by two. After Moore tied it with Indiana State's first field goal in almost eight minutes, the Bluejays went ahead to stay with a 7-0 run started by two free throws and a layup by Tolliver. "We just picked it up on defense," said Tolliver, who missed much of the first half after needing seven stitches to close a gash over his right eye. "It was really a good stretch that we had and got the lead." Creighton was up 59-49 with 3:48 left after a 3-pointer by Mathies and a steal for a layup by Porter. The Sycamores were within six with two minutes left, but Tolliver scored inside at 1:49 and the Bluejays held on with free throws for their fifth victory of the season at home in which they had trailed by 10 or more points. "It was frustrating for us to play so well for 25 or 26 minutes," Moss said. "Then it was like a different team out there." The Sycamores shot 71 percent (15-for-21) to open the game and finished the first half at 63 percent (15-24) in building a 38-27 lead. It was 20-19 when Indiana State used a 14-3 run, highlighted by three straight 3-pointers, to lead by 12. Indiana State was 5-for-6 on 3-pointers in the first 20 minutes. The Bluejays were 4-for-13 from beyond the arc and made only 31 percent (10-29) overall from the field. For the game, Indiana State shot 47 percent (25-53) and Creighton made only 40 percent (21-52). "You can't expect to keep shooting 71 percent, but that's still pretty good," Schnitker said. "It was the other areas of our game -- rebounding, defense and turnovers -- that hurt us. "It was getting a little frustrating at the end because we knew it should have been closer." Indiana State had only 24 points the entire second half, eight coming in the final minute. The Bluejays also had a wide edge in free throws, going 18-for-24 to 3-for-4 for the Sycamores. Mathies said the key was controlling Moss in the second half. "He started out on fire," Mathies said. "We had to take him out of the game in order to gain control." Porter said, "They wore down and (Moss) started missing shots that he was making in the first half." Still, the comebacks have been getting tiresome. "We've been in that situation too many times this season," Mathies said. No more. The rest of the season will be away from the comfy Qwest Center Omaha.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
